title: Verbs for the Cycle of Life

data.translation: to become pregnant
(of a living being) to produce offspring or more of itself
to produce offspring sexually, typically involving the union of male and female reproductive cells
to deliver an offspring
to feed an infant or young child directly from the mother's breast, providing essential nutrition through breast milk
to gradually reduce or stop a baby's dependency on breastfeeding or bottle-feeding, introducing them to other foods and drinks
to change from being a child into an adult little by little
(of children) to become too big to fit into one's old clothes or belongings
to develop mentally, physically, and emotionally
to get older
to no longer be alive
to lose one's life, often terribly or suddenly
to no longer be alive
to no longer be alive
to become conscious again after sleeping
to stop sleeping and become aware
to no longer be asleep
to choose not to go to bed and remain awake
to wake someone up
to wake up and get out of bed
to rest our mind and body, with our eyes closed
to take a short period of sleep, typically during the day
to sleep, typically in a calm and peaceful manner
to sleep lightly for a short amount of time
to sleep lightly for a brief amount of time
to take a short and light nap, typically lasting only a few minutes
to be in a state of light sleep
to take a short and casual nap
to remain asleep without being awakened by a noise or activity
to fall asleep, often unintentionally or unexpectedly
to feel less worried or stressed
to stop working, moving, or doing an activity for a period of time and sit or lie down to relax
to lie or rest in a pleasant warmth, such as sunlight
to position oneself comfortably and cozily
to relax in a comfortable way
to relax and take a break especially when feeling stressed or upset
to relax and stop worrying after being under stress
to relax and release tension, especially after a period of stress or pressure
to let go of tension and anxiety
to relax and enjoy oneself in a leisurely way, often by lying around and doing nothing productive
to be at rest or not actively doing anything
to relax and make oneself comfortable in a sitting position
to unwind and relax, often by engaging in leisure activities or resting
to relax lazily
to find a place to rest or settle
to relax the body and mind through inactivity or rest
to take air into one's lungs and let it out again
to take air or substances into the lungs by breathing in
to breathe air or smoke out through the mouth or nose
to breathe in and out, taking in oxygen and expelling carbon dioxide from the lungs
to draw air into and expel it from the lungs
to breathe in short, quick gasps with effort or exertion
to breathe in sharply with an open mouth, often in response to surprise, pain, or intense emotions
to breathe quickly and loudly, often due to excitement, exertion, or energetic activity
to unexpectedly open one's mouth wide and deeply breathe in because of being bored or tired
to make a sudden, involuntary sound caused by a spasm of the diaphragm, often as a result of eating or drinking too quickly
to release air from the stomach through the mouth
to expel gas audibly from the stomach through the mouth
to break down food in the body and to absorb its nutrients and necessary substances
to break down substances like food or drugs to produce energy or support various bodily functions
to become red in the face, especially as a result of shyness or shame
to become red, often in response to emotions like embarrassment, shame, or surprise
to experience a reddening of the skin, typically in the face, due to emotions like embarrassment, excitement, or strong reactions
to become red in the face, especially as a result of embarrassment or shame
to produce small drops of liquid on the surface of one's skin
to produce small drops of liquid on the surface of the skin, often as a result of physical exertion, anxiety, or heat
to open and close the eyes quickly and for a brief moment
to release liquid waste from the body
to expel urine from the body
to release liquid waste from the body
to bite and crush food into smaller pieces with the teeth to make it easier to swallow
to cut into flesh, food, etc. using the teeth
to give a small, quick bite
to crush or grind something loudly and noisily with the teeth
to chew or bite down on something with a strong, audible, and repeated motion
to chew steadily or vigorously, often making a crunching sound
to eat or drink noisily by inhaling a liquid or soft food, such as soup or noodles, often with a distinctive, impolite sound
to chew on something persistently
to chew food by biting and grinding it with the teeth
to gently bite, usually as a sign of affection or when feeling nervous
to exhale forcefully through the mouth
to pull air, liquid, etc. into the mouth by using the muscles of the mouth and the lips
to forcefully release saliva or phlegm from the mouth
to pass the tongue over a surface, typically to taste or eat something
(of saliva) to flow from the mouth, usually in response to excitement or anticipation
to let saliva flow uncontrollably from the mouth, often due to excitement or hunger
to allow saliva to flow excessively from the mouth
to generate saliva, typically triggered by the expectation or smell of delicious food
to swirl a liquid in one's mouth and throat, to maintain oral hygiene
to put water, coffee, or other type of liquid inside of our body through our mouth
to drink a liquid by taking a small amount each time
to drink a large quantity of a liquid in a hearty, enthusiastic manner
to consume or absorb liquids, especially beverages
to drink something in one large gulp or swallow
to consume a beverage, usually a carbonated or alcoholic one, quickly and in large gulps
to quickly and often carelessly consume large amounts of liquid, particularly alcoholic drinks
to consume a drink or liquid food
to put food into the mouth, then chew and swallow it
to consume completely, especially in reference to food
to eat a small amount of food between meals, typically as a quick and informal meal
to have dinner
to eat something eagerly and in large quantities, often implying intense hunger or enjoyment
to drink or eat excessively
to eat greedily and in large quantities
to eat something quickly and greedily, often making loud and rapid swallowing sounds
to participate in consuming food
to cause food, drink, or another substance to pass from the mouth down into the stomach, using the muscles of the throat
to eat snacks or light meals
to eat and drink abundantly, often as part of a celebration or special occasion
to start eating with enthusiasm
to give food to a person or an animal
to give someone or something food and other things which are needed in order to grow, live, and maintain health
(of sheep, cows, etc.) to feed on the grass in a field
to eat or drink something
to swallow quickly or greedily, often in one swift motion
to drink something, especially an alcoholic beverage, enthusiastically, and in large quantities
to eat only a certain type of food
to regularly eat a specific type of food to stay alive and grow

title: Verbs for Body Language and Acts of Affection

data.translation: to express a meaning with a movement of the hands, face, head, etc.
to move one's head up and down as a sign of agreement, understanding, or greeting
to make a quick and involuntary movement in response to a surprise, pain, or fear
to make small, restless movements or gestures due to nervousness or impatience
to draw back involuntarily, often in response to fear, pain, embarrassment, or discomfort
to gently push or prod someone or something, often to get attention or suggest a course of action
to raise one's hand and move it from side to side to greet someone or attract their attention
to quickly open and close one eye as a sign of affection or to indicate something is a secret or a joke
to bring your eyebrows closer together showing anger, sadness, or confusion
to momentarily raise one's shoulders to express indifference
to move in an uncomfortable or restless manner with twisting or contorted motions
to push out one's lips as an expression of displeasure, anger, or sadness
to twist our face in an ugly way because of pain, strong dislike, etc., or when trying to be funny
to touch someone else's lips or other body parts with one's lips to show love, sexual desire, respect, etc.
to give a quick and light kiss
to kiss briefly and affectionately
to kiss passionately and intimately
to engage in affectionate and intimate behavior, such as hugging, kissing, or cuddling
to tightly and closely hold someone in one's arms, typically a person one loves
to hold someone tightly in one's arms, especially to show affection
to hold close in one's arms or embrace affectionately, especially in a loving or comforting manner
to put one's arms around the body of another person
to hold someone or something in one's arms or hands gently and carefully
to touch in a gentle and loving way
to touch or handle tenderly and affectionately
to kiss lovingly or passionately
to tell someone our name so they can know us, or to tell them someone else's name so they can know each other, normally happening in the first meeting
to make someone familiar with a person or thing by introducing or providing information about them
to come together as previously scheduled for social interaction or a prearranged purpose
to go somewhere because we want to spend time with someone
to come across or meet someone or something, often unexpectedly or by accident
to discover, meet, or find someone or something by accident
to meet someone by chance and unexpectedly
to meet up with someone in order to cooperate or socialize
to visit a place or someone without a prior arrangement, often casually and briefly
to unexpectedly meet someone, particularly someone familiar
to make a short, usually unplanned, visit to a place or person
to meet someone unexpectedly
to visit a place or someone briefly, often without a prior arrangement
to visit or make a brief stay at a place or with someone
to communicate with someone by calling or writing to them
to make a phone call or try to reach someone on the phone
to communicate with someone using a telephone
to telephone a place or person
to return a phone call or contact someone again when the first attempt to communicate was missed or unsuccessful
to casually and briefly visit someone
to enter a telephone number using a rotary or keypad on a telephone or mobile device in order to make a call
to contact someone again later to provide a response or reply, often after taking time to consider or research the matter
to signal someone, typically by using an intercom, to gain attention or request entry
to end a phone call by breaking the connection
to join in an event, activity, etc.
to bring individuals together to form a united or organized collection, often for collaboration, discussion, or shared activities
to remain united or connected as a group, especially in difficult situations
to gather in a group
to come together in a place, typically for a specific purpose or activity
to meet or bring together a group of people for an official meeting
to come together in a group, often for a specific purpose or activity
(of people) to form a united group
(of people) to gather in a place for a particular purpose
to gather or bring together things into one place
to gather in a place in large numbers
to assist individuals in solving disagreements and becoming closer
to gather people or things, often to organize or deal with them
to gather or travel to a place in large, dense groups
to gather closely, usually for privacy, protection, or discussion
to bring together again, especially after a period of separation
to meet at an agreed-upon time and place, often for a specific purpose or activity
to become a part of a group or gathering
to go back to someone or something after a separation
to take part in an activity or event that others are already engaged in
to collaborate and work collectively
to officially register oneself or someone else as a participant in a course, school, etc.
to be present at a meeting, event, conference, etc.
to be acquainted or familiar with a person, thing, place, etc.
to have a friendly or good relationship with someone or something
to make friends with someone
to spend time with or become friendly with someone, often when it is not allowed or expected
to become friendly again with another person after ending a disagreement or dispute
to go out with someone that you are having a romantic relationship with or may soon start to have one
to regularly spend time with a person that one likes and has a sexual or romantic relationship with
to abruptly cut off communication with someone, especially online, without explanation
to behave in a way that shows a person is only sexually drawn to someone, with no serious intention of starting a relationship
to persuade someone into engaging in sexual activity, often through charm
to romantically pursue someone by expressing interest and affection to establish a relationship
to have very strong feelings for someone or something that is important to us and we like a lot and want to take care of
to ask a person to marry one
to promise to marry someone, typically with a formal ceremony or agreement, often involving the exchange of rings
to become someone's husband or wife
to legally become someone's wife or husband
to be sexually unfaithful to one's partner by engaging in romantic or intimate activities with someone else
to legally end a marriage
to end the relationship or live apart from a partner
to end a romantic relationship or marriage
to guide and take care of one's children to help them grow
to care for and support the growth and development of a child until they reach adulthood
to take someone's child into one's family and become their legal parent
to provide care and a supportive home for children, often not biologically related, during difficult times
to reject or deny any association or relationship with someone or something
to joke about something, often by giving false or inaccurate information
to say something funny or behave in a way that makes people laugh
to playfully annoy someone by making jokes or sarcastic remarks
to play a mischievous trick or practical joke on someone, often for amusement and laughs
to imitate someone or something, often using sarcasm or teasing
to make fun of  someone or something
to trick someone by making them believe something false or absurd
to deceive someone by creating a false story or situation
to engage in light, playful, and teasing conversation or exchange of remarks
to playfully tease someone in a friendly way, often involving light-hearted jokes or gentle ridicule
to tease or joke with someone in a lighthearted and good-natured manner
to say or do something playfully or without serious intent
to trick or deceive someone, often as a playful prank
to tease in a playful manner
to joke, especially in a playful manner
to intentionally say or write something that is not true
to tell a small or trivial lie that is not meant to cause harm or serious consequences
to trick opponents in games like poker by acting confidently with a weak hand, making them think one has a strong hand
to act in a specific way in order to make others believe that something is the case when actually it is not so
to claim or suggest something, often falsely or without proof
to pretend, often with the intent to deceive or mislead others
to disguise or pretend to be someone or something else, often by wearing a mask or adopting a false identity
to make a person believe something untrue
to deceive a person so that they do what one wants
to cause someone to believe something that is not true, typically by lying or omitting important information
to deceive someone into believing something that is not true, often by creating false hopes or illusions
to illegally obtain money or property from someone by tricking them
to trick someone, often by confusing or misleading them with clever or deceptive tactics
to control or influence someone cleverly for personal gain or advantage
to trick someone into believing something that is not true
to deceive a person, often by hiding the truth or using clever tactics to mislead them
to use deceit in order to deprive someone of their money or other possessions
to pretend to support or agree with someone or something to keep things peaceful or for one's own gain
to deceive someone in order to deprive them of something, such as money, property, or information
to trick someone, often by taking advantage of their trust or naivety
to deceive someone through dishonesty, often resulting in the loss of something valuable
to defeat or surpass someone in a clever or cunning manner
to unfairly take money or what someone deserves from them through dishonest methods
to deceive someone through cunning or dishonest tactics, often for personal gain
to provide incorrect directions to someone, leading them in the wrong direction or causing them to become lost
to trick someone, typically with the intention of depriving them of something valuable
to be disloyal to a person, a group of people, or one's country by giving information about them to their enemy
to develop opposition or hostility toward something or someone once supported or favored
to take advantage of someone by charging them too much money or selling them a defective product
to betray a person that one is in cooperation with, often when they want to do something illegal together
to treat someone or something poorly or unfairly
to treat someone or something with cruelty or violence, often causing harm or suffering
to behave cruelly or harshly towards someone or something
to cruelly or violently treat a person or an animal, especially regularly or repeatedly
to unfairly control or harm someone through unjust use of power or authority
to use power or influence to frighten or harm someone weaker or more vulnerable
to make someone a target of harm, unfair treatment, or exploitation
to manipulate someone into questioning their own perceptions, memories, or sanity, often by denying or distorting the truth
to take advantage of someone's feelings or weaknesses
to treat someone unfairly or unjustly
to make someone feel embarrassed or disgraced, often through public criticism
to cause someone to feel extreme embarrassment or shame
to make a person feel ashamed, uneasy, or nervous, especially in front of other people
to make someone feel uneasy, embarrassed, or anxious
to make someone feel uneasy and ashamed
to cause someone to feel extremely embarrassed or ashamed, often by publicly exposing their weaknesses or shortcomings
to make something or someone seem less important
to bring shame or dishonor on oneself or other people
to regard someone or something as inferior or unworthy of respect or consideration
to make someone feel ashamed by reminding them of their weaknesses or limitations
to make someone or something be no longer respected
to unfairly influence or manipulate something or someone in favor of one particular opinion or point of view
to unfairly influence someone's opinion or judgment about someone or something
to unfairly treat a person or group of people based on their sex, race, etc.
to disadvantage or harm someone or something by hindering their progress
to treat someone unfairly or cruelly, often because of their race, gender, religion, or beliefs
to treat a person, group, or concept as insignificant or of secondary or minor importance
to make one feel isolated or hostile toward a person or group
to focus on a particular person or thing from a group in either a positive or negative manner
